title: Display Completely Broken when a Website with High Graphical Content is Opened
content:
Hi,

It's been a while since this problem first occurred but I am now very sure that this is about Firefox and not about graphics driver. This happens both when the hardware acceleration is turned on and turned off.

When I open a website that has mainly images or videos, the browser goes blitz (Reddit, Twitch, etc.). Screen splits to multiple views, it starts flickering and continues until I switch to another tab or quit Firefox. For flickering to stop, I need to restart the computer. I can also send a video if you can communicate a proper way of sharing. (Drive link, youtube, etc.)

Is there any way I can ensure Firefox does not break things on my computer?

Thanks
creator: notaname

title: I'm at my wits end with Firefox!
content:
t's been a nightmare. My Firefox keeps crashing, and it's driving me crazy! I can be in the middle of something important, like researching for a project or catching up on my https://dpforboys.com/ favorite shows, and suddenly, bam, it's closed. No error message, just gone.

I've tried everything I can think of:

Reinstalled Firefox multiple times Cleared cache and cookies Disabled extensions one by one Updated my graphics drivers Checked for malware Nothing seems to work. It's like Firefox has a mind of its own, and it's determined to make my life difficult. I'm starting to think it's a hardware issue, but I'm not sure.

I need help! Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
creator: socialwithwaseem

title: Loads content on Firefox even if the tab or the window is not visible, is possibile?
content:
I hope this message finds you well! I use two versions of Firefox: the stable one and the developer one.

The developer version is set to start with the Windows start and is set to be minimized on the Windows try but since some years Firefox, as other browser do, never load the page or the tab content if the tab or the window is not active, been seen by the user.

I'm asking if there is some hidden settings in the about:config that allow me to disable this and let Firefox load tabs or page always, not only when the tab or windows is seen by me.

Thank you.
creator: peopleinside

title: Come impostare Firefox per caricare le pagine anche se non si è attivi nella scheda o nella pagina?
content:
Ciao, mi auguro tutto bene!

Sul mio computer Windows utilizzo due versioni di Firefox: la stabile e la developer. Utilizzo la developer per avviarsi con Windows e ridursi ad icona, inoltre come pagina principale ho impostato la pagina di una live chat con cui vengo informato e gestisco chat che provengono da alcuni siti web.

Ho il problema che Firefox (come anche altri browser) negli ultimi anni hanno smesso di caricare le pagine se la finestra o scheda non è in primo piano visualizzata dall'utente.

C'è qualche impostazione, magari anche in about:config che mi permetta di dire al browser di caricare sempre le schede e le pagine anche se non attive e visualizzate?

Grazie.
creator: peopleinside

title: Mozilla mayhem for Mac 10.14
content:
Something out of the ordinary occurred the other day when my copy of Firefox no longer was able to connect to the internet. A bit of searching revealed that my Mac system no longer compatible with Firefox 115.4

The Mozilla website clearly showed that older Mac systems, such as 10.12 10.13 and 10.14 were no longer able to work with the latest Firefox update and to download Firefox 115 ESR version.

After starting it up the newer version just showed a brand new version without any of my often used bookmarks, extensions, history etc.

I believe it’s possible to return all those often used elements to my everyday browser experience but just how, befuddles me! Perhaps there is a website detailing this information?
creator: pcd2k

title: Non-responsive and slow

Thanks for any help I can get to put these two issues behind me.

title: FIREFOX UPDATE DISASTER
content: I had a Firefox update I believe last Friday 16th August. This resulted in a disastrous event whereby an error message displayed: error message 129. I finally managed to open a version of Firefox but I had lost all my bookmarks and open tabs. I also had to sign in to all existing websites which I had previously automatically had access to. The strange thing was that the version of Firefox that I had opened was from 2022 sometime because of the data that appeared. I am totally devastated by the loss of my bookmarks. :( What can you do to help?
creator: bassettjohn

title: Webappsstore.sqlite database is very large (85+ MB)
content:
I know I'm not the first person to report this problem, but the webappsstore.sqlite file in my profile folder is very large, over 85 MB. I don't want to delete it because I don't want to lose my bookmark data, which are stored in this database (I even double-checked this by temporarily moving the database out of my profile folder, basically as if it were "deleted," and started Firefox, and sure enough all my bookmarks' data were gone).

I tried running `sqlite3 vacuum` on it, but that only reduced it to 79 MB. Is there another way to further cleanup old or unimportant data in this database?

-- Firefox 64-bit v129.0.1 Windows 11
creator: fiffox
